00020 /*
00021 *********************************************************************************************************
00022 *                                            LOCAL CONSTANTS
00023 *********************************************************************************************************
00024 */
00025 
00026 #define  OS_MUTEX_KEEP_LOWER_8   0x00FF
00027 #define  OS_MUTEX_KEEP_UPPER_8   0xFF00
00028 
00029 #define  OS_MUTEX_AVAILABLE      0x00FF
00030 
00031 
00032 #if OS_MUTEX_EN > 0
00033 /*
00034 *********************************************************************************************************
00035 *                                   ACCEPT MUTUAL EXCLUSION SEMAPHORE
00036 *
00037 * Description: This  function checks the mutual exclusion semaphore to see if a resource is available.
00038 *              Unlike OSMutexPend(), OSMutexAccept() does not suspend the calling task if the resource is
00039 *              not available or the event did not occur.
00040 *
00041 * Arguments  : pevent     is a pointer to the event control block
00042 *
00043 *              err        is a pointer to an error code which will be returned to your application:
00044 *                            OS_NO_ERR          if the call was successful.
00045 *                            OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE  if 'pevent' is not a pointer to a mutex
00046 *                            OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL 'pevent' is a NULL pointer
00047 *                            OS_ERR_PEND_ISR     if you called this function from an ISR
00048 *
00049 * Returns    : == 1       if the resource is available, the mutual exclusion semaphore is acquired
00050 *              == 0       a) if the resource is not available
00051 *                         b) you didn't pass a pointer to a mutual exclusion semaphore
00052 *                         c) you called this function from an ISR
00053 *
00054 * Warning(s) : This function CANNOT be called from an ISR because mutual exclusion semaphores are
00055 *              intended to be used by tasks only.
00056 *********************************************************************************************************
00057 */
00058 
00059 #if OS_MUTEX_ACCEPT_EN > 0
00060 INT8U  OSMutexAccept (OS_EVENT *pevent, INT8U *err)
00061 {
00062 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                            /* Allocate storage for CPU status register     */
00063     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00064 #endif    
00065 
00066 
00067 
00068 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00069     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                           /* Validate 'err'                               */
00070         return (0);
00071     }
00072     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                     /* Validate 'pevent'                            */
00073         *err = OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL;
00074         return (0);
00075     }
00076 #endif                                                     
00077     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_MUTEX) {  /* Validate event block type                    */
00078         *err = OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE;
00079         return (0);
00080     }
00081     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                            /* Make sure it's not called from an ISR        */
00082         *err = OS_ERR_PEND_ISR;
00083         return (0);
00084     }
00085     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();                                                           /* Get value (0 or 1) of Mutex                  */
00086     if ((pevent->OSEventCnt & OS_MUTEX_KEEP_LOWER_8) == OS_MUTEX_AVAILABLE) {     
00087         pevent->OSEventCnt &= OS_MUTEX_KEEP_UPPER_8;   /*      Mask off LSByte (Acquire Mutex)         */
00088         pevent->OSEventCnt |= OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio;     /*      Save current task priority in LSByte    */
00089         pevent->OSEventPtr  = (void *)OSTCBCur;        /*      Link TCB of task owning Mutex           */
00090         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00091         *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00092         return (1);
00093     }
00094     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00095     *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00096     return (0);
00097 }
00098 #endif                                                     
00099 
00100 /*$PAGE*/
00101 /*
00102 *********************************************************************************************************
00103 *                                  CREATE A MUTUAL EXCLUSION SEMAPHORE
00104 *
00105 * Description: This function creates a mutual exclusion semaphore.
00106 *
00107 * Arguments  : prio          is the priority to use when accessing the mutual exclusion semaphore.  In
00108 *                            other words, when the semaphore is acquired and a higher priority task
00109 *                            attempts to obtain the semaphore then the priority of the task owning the
00110 *                            semaphore is raised to this priority.  It is assumed that you will specify
00111 *                            a priority that is LOWER in value than ANY of the tasks competing for the
00112 *                            mutex.
00113 *
00114 *              err           is a pointer to an error code which will be returned to your application:
00115 *                               OS_NO_ERR           if the call was successful.
00116 *                               OS_ERR_CREATE_ISR   if you attempted to create a MUTEX from an ISR
00117 *                               OS_PRIO_EXIST       if a task at the priority inheritance priority
00118 *                                                   already exist.
00119 *                               OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL  No more event control blocks available.
00120 *                               OS_PRIO_INVALID     if the priority you specify is higher that the 
00121 *                                                   maximum allowed (i.e. > OS_LOWEST_PRIO)
00122 *
00123 * Returns    : != (void *)0  is a pointer to the event control clock (OS_EVENT) associated with the
00124 *                            created mutex.
00125 *              == (void *)0  if an error is detected.
00126 *
00127 * Note(s)    : 1) The LEAST significant 8 bits of '.OSEventCnt' are used to hold the priority number
00128 *                 of the task owning the mutex or 0xFF if no task owns the mutex.
00129 *              2) The MOST  significant 8 bits of '.OSEventCnt' are used to hold the priority number
00130 *                 to use to reduce priority inversion.
00131 *********************************************************************************************************
00132 */
00133 
00134 OS_EVENT  *OSMutexCreate (INT8U prio, INT8U *err)
00135 {
00136     OS_EVENT  *pevent;
00137 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                /* Allocate storage for CPU status register */
00138     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00139 #endif    
00140 
00141 
00142 
00143 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00144     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                               /* Validate 'err'                           */
00145         return ((OS_EVENT *)0);
00146     }
00147     if (prio >= OS_LOWEST_PRIO) {                          /* Validate PIP                             */
00148         *err = OS_PRIO_INVALID;
00149         return ((OS_EVENT *)0);
00150     }
00151 #endif
00152     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                                /* See if called from ISR ...               */
00153         *err = OS_ERR_CREATE_ISR;                          /* ... can't CREATE mutex from an ISR       */
00154         return ((OS_EVENT *)0);
00155     }
00156     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00157     if (OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] != (OS_TCB *)0) {               /* Mutex priority must not already exist    */
00158         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                                /* Task already exist at priority ...       */
00159         *err = OS_PRIO_EXIST;                              /* ... inheritance priority                 */
00160         return ((OS_EVENT *)0);                            
00161     }
00162     OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] = (OS_TCB *)1;                      /* Reserve the table entry                  */
00163     pevent             = OSEventFreeList;                  /* Get next free event control block        */
00164     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                         /* See if an ECB was available              */
00165         OSTCBPrioTbl[prio] = (OS_TCB *)0;                  /* No, Release the table entry              */
00166         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00167         *err               = OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL;           /* No more event control blocks             */
00168         return (pevent);
00169     }
00170     OSEventFreeList        = (OS_EVENT *)OSEventFreeList->OSEventPtr;   /* Adjust the free list        */
00171     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00172     pevent->OSEventType    = OS_EVENT_TYPE_MUTEX;
00173     pevent->OSEventCnt     = ((INT16U)prio << 8) | OS_MUTEX_AVAILABLE;  /* Resource is available       */
00174     pevent->OSEventPtr     = (void *)0;                                 /* No task owning the mutex    */
00175 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00176     pevent->OSEventName[0] = '?';
00177     pevent->OSEventName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00178 #endif
00179     OS_EventWaitListInit(pevent);
00180     *err                   = OS_NO_ERR;
00181     return (pevent);
00182 }
00183 
00184 /*$PAGE*/
00185 /*
00186 *********************************************************************************************************
00187 *                                          DELETE A MUTEX
00188 *
00189 * Description: This function deletes a mutual exclusion semaphore and readies all tasks pending on the it.
00190 *
00191 * Arguments  : pevent        is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired mutex.
00192 *
00193 *              opt           determines delete options as follows:
00194 *                            opt == OS_DEL_NO_PEND   Delete mutex ONLY if no task pending
00195 *                            opt == OS_DEL_ALWAYS    Deletes the mutex even if tasks are waiting.
00196 *                                                    In this case, all the tasks pending will be readied.
00197 *
00198 *              err           is a pointer to an error code that can contain one of the following values:
00199 *                            OS_NO_ERR               The call was successful and the mutex was deleted
00200 *                            OS_ERR_DEL_ISR          If you attempted to delete the MUTEX from an ISR
00201 *                            OS_ERR_INVALID_OPT      An invalid option was specified
00202 *                            OS_ERR_TASK_WAITING     One or more tasks were waiting on the mutex
00203 *                            OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE       If you didn't pass a pointer to a mutex
00204 *                            OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL      If 'pevent' is a NULL pointer.
00205 *
00206 * Returns    : pevent        upon error
00207 *              (OS_EVENT *)0 if the mutex was successfully deleted.
00208 *
00209 * Note(s)    : 1) This function must be used with care.  Tasks that would normally expect the presence of
00210 *                 the mutex MUST check the return code of OSMutexPend().
00211 *              2) This call can potentially disable interrupts for a long time.  The interrupt disable
00212 *                 time is directly proportional to the number of tasks waiting on the mutex.
00213 *              3) Because ALL tasks pending on the mutex will be readied, you MUST be careful because the
00214 *                 resource(s) will no longer be guarded by the mutex.
00215 *********************************************************************************************************
00216 */
00217 
00218 #if OS_MUTEX_DEL_EN
00219 OS_EVENT  *OSMutexDel (OS_EVENT *pevent, INT8U opt, INT8U *err)
00220 {
00221     BOOLEAN    tasks_waiting;
00222     INT8U      pip;
00223 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                /* Allocate storage for CPU status register */
00224     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00225 #endif    
00226 
00227 
00228 
00229 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00230     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                               /* Validate 'err'                           */
00231         return ((OS_EVENT *)0);
00232     }
00233     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                         /* Validate 'pevent'                        */
00234         *err = OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL;
00235         return ((OS_EVENT *)0);
00236     }
00237 #endif
00238     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_MUTEX) {      /* Validate event block type                */
00239         *err = OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE;
00240         return (pevent);
00241     }
00242     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                                /* See if called from ISR ...               */
00243         *err = OS_ERR_DEL_ISR;                             /* ... can't DELETE from an ISR             */
00244         return (pevent);
00245     }
00246     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00247     if (pevent->OSEventGrp != 0x00) {                      /* See if any tasks waiting on mutex        */
00248         tasks_waiting = TRUE;                              /* Yes                                      */
00249     } else {
00250         tasks_waiting = FALSE;                             /* No                                       */
00251     }
00252     switch (opt) {
00253         case OS_DEL_NO_PEND:                               /* Delete mutex only if no task waiting     */
00254              if (tasks_waiting == FALSE) {
00255 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00256                  pevent->OSEventName[0] = '?';             /* Unknown name                             */
00257                  pevent->OSEventName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00258 #endif
00259                  pip                 = (INT8U)(pevent->OSEventCnt >> 8);
00260                  OSTCBPrioTbl[pip]   = (OS_TCB *)0;        /* Free up the PIP                          */
00261                  pevent->OSEventType = OS_EVENT_TYPE_UNUSED;
00262                  pevent->OSEventPtr  = OSEventFreeList;    /* Return Event Control Block to free list  */
00263                  pevent->OSEventCnt  = 0;
00264                  OSEventFreeList     = pevent;
00265                  OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00266                  *err                = OS_NO_ERR;
00267                  return ((OS_EVENT *)0);                   /* Mutex has been deleted                   */
00268              } else {
00269                  OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00270                  *err                = OS_ERR_TASK_WAITING;
00271                  return (pevent);
00272              }
00273 
00274         case OS_DEL_ALWAYS:                                /* Always delete the mutex                  */
00275              while (pevent->OSEventGrp != 0x00) {          /* Ready ALL tasks waiting for mutex        */
00276                  (void)OS_EventTaskRdy(pevent, (void *)0, OS_STAT_MUTEX);
00277              }
00278 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00279              pevent->OSEventName[0] = '?';                 /* Unknown name                             */
00280              pevent->OSEventName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00281 #endif
00282              pip                 = (INT8U)(pevent->OSEventCnt >> 8);
00283              OSTCBPrioTbl[pip]   = (OS_TCB *)0;            /* Free up the PIP                          */
00284              pevent->OSEventType = OS_EVENT_TYPE_UNUSED;
00285              pevent->OSEventPtr  = OSEventFreeList;        /* Return Event Control Block to free list  */
00286              pevent->OSEventCnt  = 0;
00287              OSEventFreeList     = pevent;                 /* Get next free event control block        */
00288              OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00289              if (tasks_waiting == TRUE) {                  /* Reschedule only if task(s) were waiting  */
00290                  OS_Sched();                               /* Find highest priority task ready to run  */
00291              }
00292              *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00293              return ((OS_EVENT *)0);                       /* Mutex has been deleted                   */
00294 
00295         default:
00296              OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00297              *err = OS_ERR_INVALID_OPT;
00298              return (pevent);
00299     }
00300 }
00301 #endif
00302 
00303 /*$PAGE*/
00304 /*
00305 *********************************************************************************************************
00306 *                                  PEND ON MUTUAL EXCLUSION SEMAPHORE
00307 *
00308 * Description: This function waits for a mutual exclusion semaphore.
00309 *
00310 * Arguments  : pevent        is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired
00311 *                            mutex.
00312 *
00313 *              timeout       is an optional timeout period (in clock ticks).  If non-zero, your task will
00314 *                            wait for the resource up to the amount of time specified by this argument.
00315 *                            If you specify 0, however, your task will wait forever at the specified
00316 *                            mutex or, until the resource becomes available.
00317 *
00318 *              err           is a pointer to where an error message will be deposited.  Possible error
00319 *                            messages are:
00320 *                               OS_NO_ERR          The call was successful and your task owns the mutex
00321 *                               OS_TIMEOUT         The mutex was not available within the specified time.
00322 *                               OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE  If you didn't pass a pointer to a mutex
00323 *                               OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL 'pevent' is a NULL pointer
00324 *                               OS_ERR_PEND_ISR    If you called this function from an ISR and the result
00325 *                                                  would lead to a suspension.
00326 *                               OS_ERR_PIP_LOWER   If the priority of the task that owns the Mutex is
00327 *                                                  HIGHER (i.e. a lower number) than the PIP.  This error
00328 *                                                  indicates that you did not set the PIP higher (lower 
00329 *                                                  number) than ALL the tasks that compete for the Mutex.
00330 *                                                  Unfortunately, this is something that could not be
00331 *                                                  detected when the Mutex is created because we don't know
00332 *                                                  what tasks will be using the Mutex.
00333 *
00334 * Returns    : none
00335 *
00336 * Note(s)    : 1) The task that owns the Mutex MUST NOT pend on any other event while it owns the mutex.
00337 *              2) You MUST NOT change the priority of the task that owns the mutex
00338 *********************************************************************************************************
00339 */
00340 void  OSMutexPend (OS_EVENT *pevent, INT16U timeout, INT8U *err)
00341 {
00342     INT8U      pip;                                        /* Priority Inheritance Priority (PIP)      */
00343     INT8U      mprio;                                      /* Mutex owner priority                     */
00344     BOOLEAN    rdy;                                        /* Flag indicating task was ready           */
00345     OS_TCB    *ptcb;
00346     OS_EVENT  *pevent2;
00347     INT8U      y;
00348 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                /* Allocate storage for CPU status register */
00349     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00350 #endif    
00351 
00352 
00353 
00354 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00355     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                               /* Validate 'err'                           */
00356         return;
00357     }
00358     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                         /* Validate 'pevent'                        */
00359         *err = OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL;
00360         return;
00361     }
00362 #endif
00363     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_MUTEX) {      /* Validate event block type                */
00364         *err = OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE;
00365         return;
00366     }
00367     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                                /* See if called from ISR ...               */
00368         *err = OS_ERR_PEND_ISR;                            /* ... can't PEND from an ISR               */
00369         return;
00370     }
00371     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();                                                                   
00372     pip = (INT8U)(pevent->OSEventCnt >> 8);                /* Get PIP from mutex                       */
00373                                                            /* Is Mutex available?                      */
00374     if ((INT8U)(pevent->OSEventCnt & OS_MUTEX_KEEP_LOWER_8) == OS_MUTEX_AVAILABLE) {
00375         pevent->OSEventCnt &= OS_MUTEX_KEEP_UPPER_8;       /* Yes, Acquire the resource                */
00376         pevent->OSEventCnt |= OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio;         /*      Save priority of owning task        */
00377         pevent->OSEventPtr  = (void *)OSTCBCur;            /*      Point to owning task's OS_TCB       */
00378         if (OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio <= pip) {                  /*      PIP 'must' have a SMALLER prio ...  */
00379             OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                            /*      ... than current task!              */
00380             *err  = OS_ERR_PIP_LOWER;
00381         } else {
00382             OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00383             *err  = OS_NO_ERR;
00384         }
00385         return;
00386     }
00387     mprio = (INT8U)(pevent->OSEventCnt & OS_MUTEX_KEEP_LOWER_8);  /* No, Get priority of mutex owner   */
00388     ptcb  = (OS_TCB *)(pevent->OSEventPtr);                       /*     Point to TCB of mutex owner   */
00389     if (ptcb->OSTCBPrio > pip) {                                  /*     Need to promote prio of owner?*/
00390         if (mprio > OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio) {  
00391             y = ptcb->OSTCBY;                          
00392             if ((OSRdyTbl[y] & ptcb->OSTCBBitX) != 0x00) {        /*     See if mutex owner is ready   */
00393                 OSRdyTbl[y] &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitX;                  /*     Yes, Remove owner from Rdy ...*/
00394                 if (OSRdyTbl[y] == 0x00) {                        /*          ... list at current prio */
00395                     OSRdyGrp &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitY;
00396                 }
00397                 rdy = TRUE;
00398             } else {
00399                 pevent2 = ptcb->OSTCBEventPtr;
00400                 if (pevent2 != (OS_EVENT *)0) {                   /* Remove from event wait list       */
00401                     if ((pevent2->OSEventTbl[ptcb->OSTCBY] &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitX) == 0) {
00402                         pevent2->OSEventGrp &= ~ptcb->OSTCBBitY;
00403                     }
00404                 }
00405                 rdy = FALSE;                               /* No                                       */
00406             }
00407             ptcb->OSTCBPrio = pip;                         /* Change owner task prio to PIP            */
00408             ptcb->OSTCBY    = ptcb->OSTCBPrio >> 3;
00409             ptcb->OSTCBBitY = OSMapTbl[ptcb->OSTCBY];
00410             ptcb->OSTCBX    = ptcb->OSTCBPrio & 0x07;
00411             ptcb->OSTCBBitX = OSMapTbl[ptcb->OSTCBX];
00412             if (rdy == TRUE) {                             /* If task was ready at owner's priority ...*/
00413                 OSRdyGrp               |= ptcb->OSTCBBitY; /* ... make it ready at new priority.       */
00414                 OSRdyTbl[ptcb->OSTCBY] |= ptcb->OSTCBBitX;
00415             } else {
00416                 pevent2 = ptcb->OSTCBEventPtr;
00417                 if (pevent2 != (OS_EVENT *)0) {            /* Remove from event wait list              */
00418                     pevent2->OSEventGrp               |= ptcb->OSTCBBitY;
00419                     pevent2->OSEventTbl[ptcb->OSTCBY] |= ptcb->OSTCBBitX;
00420                 }
00421             }
00422             OSTCBPrioTbl[pip] = (OS_TCB *)ptcb;
00423         }
00424     }
00425     OSTCBCur->OSTCBStat   |= OS_STAT_MUTEX;           /* Mutex not available, pend current task        */
00426     OSTCBCur->OSTCBPendTO  = FALSE;
00427     OSTCBCur->OSTCBDly     = timeout;                 /* Store timeout in current task's TCB           */
00428     OS_EventTaskWait(pevent);                         /* Suspend task until event or timeout occurs    */
00429     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00430     OS_Sched();                                       /* Find next highest priority task ready         */
00431     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00432     if (OSTCBCur->OSTCBPendTO == TRUE) {              /* See if we timed out during the pend           */
00433         OS_EventTO(pevent);
00434         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00435         *err = OS_TIMEOUT;                            /* Indicate that we didn't get mutex within TO   */
00436         return;
00437     }
00438     OSTCBCur->OSTCBEventPtr = (OS_EVENT *)0;
00439     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00440     *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00441 }
00442 /*$PAGE*/
00443 /*
00444 *********************************************************************************************************
00445 *                                  POST TO A MUTUAL EXCLUSION SEMAPHORE
00446 *
00447 * Description: This function signals a mutual exclusion semaphore
00448 *
00449 * Arguments  : pevent              is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired
00450 *                                  mutex.
00451 *
00452 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR               The call was successful and the mutex was signaled.
00453 *              OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE       If you didn't pass a pointer to a mutex
00454 *              OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL      'pevent' is a NULL pointer
00455 *              OS_ERR_POST_ISR         Attempted to post from an ISR (not valid for MUTEXes)
00456 *              OS_ERR_NOT_MUTEX_OWNER  The task that did the post is NOT the owner of the MUTEX.
00457 *********************************************************************************************************
00458 */
00459 
00460 INT8U  OSMutexPost (OS_EVENT *pevent)
00461 {
00462     INT8U      pip;                                   /* Priority inheritance priority                 */
00463     INT8U      prio;
00464     INT8U      y;
00465 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                           /* Allocate storage for CPU status register      */
00466     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00467 #endif    
00468 
00469 
00470 
00471     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                           /* See if called from ISR ...                    */
00472         return (OS_ERR_POST_ISR);                     /* ... can't POST mutex from an ISR              */
00473     }
00474 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00475     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                    /* Validate 'pevent'                             */
00476         return (OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL);
00477     }
00478 #endif
00479     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_MUTEX) { /* Validate event block type                     */
00480         return (OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE);
00481     }                                                 
00482     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00483     pip  = (INT8U)(pevent->OSEventCnt >> 8);          /* Get priority inheritance priority of mutex    */
00484     prio = (INT8U)(pevent->OSEventCnt & OS_MUTEX_KEEP_LOWER_8);  /* Get owner's original priority      */
00485     if (OSTCBCur != (OS_TCB *)pevent->OSEventPtr) {   /* See if posting task owns the MUTEX            */
00486         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00487         return (OS_ERR_NOT_MUTEX_OWNER);
00488     }
00489     if (OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio == pip) {                 /* Did we have to raise current task's priority? */
00490         y            = OSTCBCur->OSTCBY;              /* Yes, Return to original priority              */
00491         OSRdyTbl[y] &= ~OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitX;          /*      Remove owner from ready list at 'pip'    */
00492         if (OSRdyTbl[y] == 0) {
00493             OSRdyGrp &= ~OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitY;
00494         }
00495         OSTCBCur->OSTCBPrio         = prio;
00496         OSTCBCur->OSTCBY            = prio >> 3;
00497         OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitY         = OSMapTbl[OSTCBCur->OSTCBY];
00498         OSTCBCur->OSTCBX            = prio & 0x07;
00499         OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitX         = OSMapTbl[OSTCBCur->OSTCBX];
00500         OSRdyGrp                   |= OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitY;
00501         OSRdyTbl[OSTCBCur->OSTCBY] |= OSTCBCur->OSTCBBitX;
00502         OSTCBPrioTbl[prio]          = (OS_TCB *)OSTCBCur;
00503     }
00504     OSTCBPrioTbl[pip] = (OS_TCB *)1;                  /* Reserve table entry                           */
00505     if (pevent->OSEventGrp != 0x00) {                 /* Any task waiting for the mutex?               */
00506                                                       /* Yes, Make HPT waiting for mutex ready         */
00507         prio                = OS_EventTaskRdy(pevent, (void *)0, OS_STAT_MUTEX);
00508         pevent->OSEventCnt &= OS_MUTEX_KEEP_UPPER_8;  /*      Save priority of mutex's new owner       */
00509         pevent->OSEventCnt |= prio;
00510         pevent->OSEventPtr  = OSTCBPrioTbl[prio];     /*      Link to mutex owner's OS_TCB             */
00511         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00512         OS_Sched();                                   /*      Find highest priority task ready to run  */
00513         return (OS_NO_ERR);
00514     }
00515     pevent->OSEventCnt |= OS_MUTEX_AVAILABLE;         /* No,  Mutex is now available                   */
00516     pevent->OSEventPtr  = (void *)0;
00517     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00518     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00519 }
00520 /*$PAGE*/
00521 /*
00522 *********************************************************************************************************
00523 *                                     QUERY A MUTUAL EXCLUSION SEMAPHORE
00524 *
00525 * Description: This function obtains information about a mutex
00526 *
00527 * Arguments  : pevent          is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired mutex
00528 *
00529 *              p_mutex_data    is a pointer to a structure that will contain information about the mutex
00530 *
00531 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR            The call was successful and the message was sent
00532 *              OS_ERR_QUERY_ISR     If you called this function from an ISR
00533 *              OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL   If 'pevent'       is a NULL pointer
00534 *              OS_ERR_PDATA_NULL    If 'p_mutex_data' is a NULL pointer
00535 *              OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE    If you are attempting to obtain data from a non mutex.
00536 *********************************************************************************************************
00537 */
00538 
00539 #if OS_MUTEX_QUERY_EN > 0
00540 INT8U  OSMutexQuery (OS_EVENT *pevent, OS_MUTEX_DATA *p_mutex_data)
00541 {
00542     INT8U     *psrc;
00543     INT8U     *pdest;
00544 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00545     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00546 #endif    
00547 
00548 
00549 
00550     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                                /* See if called from ISR ...               */
00551         return (OS_ERR_QUERY_ISR);                         /* ... can't QUERY mutex from an ISR        */
00552     }
00553 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00554     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                         /* Validate 'pevent'                        */
00555         return (OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL);
00556     }
00557     if (p_mutex_data == (OS_MUTEX_DATA *)0) {              /* Validate 'p_mutex_data'                  */
00558         return (OS_ERR_PDATA_NULL);
00559     }
00560 #endif
00561     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_MUTEX) {      /* Validate event block type                */
00562         return (OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE);
00563     }
00564     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00565     p_mutex_data->OSMutexPIP  = (INT8U)(pevent->OSEventCnt >> 8);
00566     p_mutex_data->OSOwnerPrio = (INT8U)(pevent->OSEventCnt & OS_MUTEX_KEEP_LOWER_8);
00567     if (p_mutex_data->OSOwnerPrio == 0xFF) {
00568         p_mutex_data->OSValue = 1;
00569     } else {
00570         p_mutex_data->OSValue = 0;
00571     }
00572     p_mutex_data->OSEventGrp  = pevent->OSEventGrp;        /* Copy wait list                           */
00573     psrc                      = &pevent->OSEventTbl[0];
00574     pdest                     = &p_mutex_data->OSEventTbl[0];
00575 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 0
00576     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00577 #endif
00578 
00579 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 1
00580     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00581 #endif
00582 
00583 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 2
00584     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00585 #endif
00586 
00587 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 3
00588     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00589 #endif
00590 
00591 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 4
00592     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00593 #endif
00594 
00595 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 5
00596     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00597 #endif
00598 
00599 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 6
00600     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00601 #endif
00602 
00603 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 7
00604     *pdest   = *psrc;
00605 #endif
00606     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00607     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00608 }
00609 #endif                                                     /* OS_MUTEX_QUERY_EN                        */
00610 #endif                                                     /* OS_MUTEX_EN                              */
